reviewText: The reason I give this DVD four stars instead of five is because I'll take unreleased Danzig videos anytime. It could've gotten five if there were some bonus features on here, such as Glenn's creepy, dark humor when he's talking to people backstage or being interviewed that we Danzig fans all love from the guy. I have to say that although I've always felt that I'm as hardened a Danzig fan as they come and I could take anything dark or creepy that Glenn Danzig could throw our way, when I saw the TOTALLY UNSENCORED video for "It's Coming Down", even I was like "WOOAAAHHH, Glenn!!........" and not in a great way..it's a hell of alot more than I was expecting...what was in that video? Can't give it away...just pick it up and you'll see what I'm talking about..I'm still saying "WOOOOOAAAHHH!! Glenn......" But that aside, any Danzig freak MUST pick this DVD up for your collection. It would be a great idea to see the other two former Danzig home videos, "Lucifuge: The Videos" and "Danzig" re-released together on one or separate DVDs in the future. As far as the videos in this new DVD, all the videos are damn dark, cool and creepy. Unfortunately, the Sistinas video is a newer one, but a song as unbelievable and awesome as Sistinas deserves a video made for it, new or old.

reviewText: I hate the final video(EXPLICIT) and disgusting made to shock. Yes Its danzig. Different versions of it's coming down, mtv, dirty,dirty dirty. Avoid the last one, word to the squeamish!. Mother. but no Original Mother video(ive heard of one, but its not the ones here??) also other classics. wish there would have been some bonus interview clips etc. thoughts and stuff. This first dvd is from the first 3 albums. the other dvd.(2nd) is of the remaining albums.
summary: Explicit! Not that good. Only if your a Danzig Fan.

reviewText: Multiple videos of same song.  More bare chested men than bare chested women.  Some seriously sick S&M on one uncensored video.  And that's about it.  Gotta wonder about Glen.  Only dvd out there of the original band and some of their hits.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was worth it alone for the videos Dirty Black Summer, Mother and It's Going Down, but as has been mentioned in every review so far, I wanted more. Some backstage footage, interviews, something - more so, because this was my favorite era of the band. Eerie, John and Chuck were still in the fold, and most of the videos come from my favorite Danzig album (III How the Gods Kill).While the aformentioned videos were very cool (I remeber the first time I saw them on MTV's Headbanger's Ball, so cool memories), a few were disappointing, like the How the Gods Kill video. Sistinas is a beautiful song, worthy of so much more than what is on the disc. The Bodies videos were cool, just the guys jamming, but I would love to see a 'real' video for this song. The alternative takes of each video were okay, but I probably wouldn't watch them again. But being the completist, I was glad they were there.Now that we're on the subject of different versions, the It's Coming Down extreme version is a hot topic among fans. Let me just say that I have a pretty strong stomach and I won't be watching that one again. I like the first version, the clean one, because it's just Glenn and the band rocking out in a dungeon. Great photography, simple (same reason I like Dirty Black Summer's video), and almost like seeing them live. Glenn's charisma as a frontman shows through, and I dig it.I am a huge fan, so this DVD was well worth picking up. The only reason it doesn't get five stars is the lack of extras. I just wanted more!
Title: N/A

reviewText: A Danzig DVD compiling a bunch of the former Misfits and Samhain frontman's videos has always been on the wishlist of many, but Archive De La Morte sadly comes up short.  Besides the videos compiled here, there are no other extras, which for Danzig fans, is a crying shame.  The videos that are here include three different versions of "Dirty Black Summer", two versions each of "How the Gods Kill" and "Bodies", three versions of "It's Coming Down", an unreleased video for the beautiful "Sistinas", and the hit live cut of "Mother".  However, there's nothing else here after that, and anything, whether it be perhaps a "making of" for one or two of the videos, or an interview with Glenn himself discussing the alternate takes of the videos, and they would have been more than welcome here.  Archive De La Morte is without a doubt worth checking out for Danzig fans and worth picking up for hardcore fans, but regardless you'll be left wanting more.
summary: Should have been more included here
Title: N/A
